text.p: Microsoft Corp Friday said it dissolved its partnership with Tele-Communications Inc (TCI).
In a statement, Microsoft said it returned TCI's $125 million investment in the Microsoft Network, an online service that has since been transformed into an Internet service.
"As the online industry has rapidly evolved, both companies agreed that it no longer makes sense to continue the partnership, which focused on MSN," Microsoft said.
TCI, the nation's largest cable television operator, acquired a 20 percent stake in MSN in 1994 for about $125 million in stock.

"Because of the direction each company is taking with the Internet, as well as the online industry's rapid evolution, it didn't make sense to be bound in a partnership for MSN specifically," said Peter Neupert, vice president of strategic partnerships at Microsoft.
"We are committed to our longstanding relationship with TCI and anticipate future business opportunities," he said.
Microsoft said both companies are actively discussing a variety of future projects.
The end of Microsoft's partnership with TCI was first reported Friday by the Wall Street Journal.
